name: gravel/sand quarry construction | gravel/sand quarry infrastructure | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/6375/documentation

Data are estimated based on an air-picture for one mine and sketches of the process. The average yearly production volume per unit (mine) is about 400'000 to 500'000 t/a and the life time is assumed to be 50 years;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]



includes the area of the infrastructure (buildings, paved roads, etc.) and the machines used for the gravel mining, does not include the area of the actual mine, which is included in mining
category: F:Construction/42:Civil engineering/429:Construction of other civil engineering projects/4290:Construction of other civil engineering projects
tags: Sector: Infrastructure & Machinery; Resource Extraction; Minerals

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The data are based on the investigation on 4 representative Swiss gravel pits; for some exchanges RER modules have been used as proxy
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: See geography This dataset has been copied from an original dataset covering the geography CH. The uncertainty has been adjusted accordingly.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Measured data of four Swiss plants
